content.description: Climb the first chimney you'll see when leaving The Roofs. Climb the chimney until you can't climb anymore, traverse left and finish up Ledgeland.
content.location: This is the first climb you'll see when you approach from Krazy Crags and The Roofs.

content.description:
Climb the left side of the pinnacle to a slanting feature, then make hard moves right to a good flake crack. Finish up horizontals above the top of the pillar.

 You can finish on either Squeeze Box or 5th of November

 "This line has scruffy trad trickery. It was cleaned on rappel but not toproped. I shinnied up the tree and left gully and girth-hitched a sling above where it touches the rock (tree was smaller 30+ years ago duh). The left rope protected the crux past the slanting feature to the bottomless crack, then a couple of cams pro-ed that to the top of the block. It needs another scrub & dig, as do many routes at minor crags.

 It climbs like some British gritstone weirdness. You could rate it E3 5c----figure that one out! " Mack Johnson
content.protection: Double ropes, long sling for tree, set of cams to 3-1/2"
content.location: Left side of the pillar on the main cliff, right of a tree.

content.description: Start at the lowest point on the face and trend up and right following a nice crack.  Place gear under the roof and using the right hand arÃªte move up to place or clip small wires in the seam then make a hard (v5ish) boulder problem to hit a horizontal crack, protect and climb out to a bolted anchor.  Or, if aiding, climb out seam to horizontal crack and to anchors.  It is possible to tr the line by climbing the access route (5.3) and scrambling to the anchor.
content.location: Last route on the main face before the gulley that splits the main cliff and the dump face.

content.description: Climb the broken dike to the top.  Good access for the TR anchors.
content.location: The farthest right route on the main cliff.  Located on the left gully wall 10' around the corner from Can the Jingo.

content.description:
Climb the chimney placing gear in the crack in the back.   Climb to a stance, protect and climb spooky/fun traverse left until you reach top of the pinnacle.  Protect and make tricky face moves to reach the top. 

  Guidebook:  Up the right chimney, then climb the center of the upper face.
content.location: Start in the right hand chimney formed by the pinnacle.

content.description: Delicate climbing off a block, move staright up to the pocket/flake.  Pinch and undercling and make a hard move to the flat edge on top.
content.location: 6' to the left of squeeze box, starts just left of a short right leaning crack.

content.description: Tallest section of cliff, roughly in the middle of the crag.  This makes up the left side of a little sunny amphitheater and The Dump Face makes up the right.
